thread.title: Plane passenger charged with terror offences after suspect package seized at Manchester Airport
thread.title_full: Plane passenger charged with terror offences after suspect package seized at Manchester Airport

author: Stephen Jones
title: Plane passenger charged with terror offences after suspect package seized at Manchester Airport
text:
News Plane passenger charged with terror offences after suspect package seized at Manchester Airport Nadeem Muhammed, 43, was arrested on suspicion of making or possessing an explosive under suspicious circumstances after a raid at his home in Bury, Greater Manchester Share The discovery was made at Manchester Airport (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man has been charged with terror offences after a suspect package was seized from a passenger at Manchester Airport. 
Nadeem Muhammed, 43, was arrested on suspicion of making or possessing an explosive under suspicious circumstances on Sunday. 
The Manchester Evening News reports that the arrest followed a raid at his home in Tinline Street, Bury. 
Officers from Greater Manchester Police (GMP) and the North West Counter Terrorism Unit carried out the raid yesterday. 
The man was originally detained at Manchester Airport on Monday January 30 - when he was stopped at security. 
A security officer at the airport allegedly detected a suspicious device and tests were carried out. 
The man was detained and later bailed. 
Officers then raided his home on Thursday and he was arrested and charged with terror offences. 
He is due to appear at Westminster magistrates’ court on Monday. The raid was carried out in Tinline Street, Bury (Photo: Google) 
It is unclear what flight the man was due to board and whether the detected device was viable. 
GMP has yet to confirm whether the charge relates to the device detected at Manchester Airport or if anything was discovered at his home. 
In a statement GMP said: "On Monday 30 January 2017, following effective security screening, a man was stopped at Manchester Airport after a suspicious package was identified passing through security. 
"Airport security stopped the man and the package was seized. The man was questioned by police officers and subsequently released for further investigation to take place. It's not clear what flight the passenger was travelling on at Manchester Airport (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
"Following further enquiries by officers from the North West Counter Terrorism Unit, on Thursday 9 February 2017, officers executed a warrant at an address on Tinline Street, Bury. 
"Yesterday, Sunday 12 February, an arrest warrant from Westminster Magistrates’ Court was issued for Making or Possessing an Explosive Substance under Suspicious Circumstances, which is covered in Section 4 of the Explosives Substance Act 1883. 
"Subsequently a 43-year-old man was arrested under the provisions of this warrant and will appear at Westminster Magistrates’ today. 
"This incident has demonstrated that the airport checks were effective with a suspicious package successfully being identified." Like us on Facebook
